title: Nextdoor website auto logs me in
content:
Curious if anyone else has seen this. If I click on a link from a random email from nextdoor, like if I get a notification on something, it auto logs me into the website. I've cleared history, remove add ons. Refreshed Firefox. I even reformatted my computer and installed firefox fresh. If I paste a link from nextdoor, it just logs in. But its only with Firefox. I tried on Chrome, IE and nothing.

Anyone else?
creator: kjohns0706

title: Third Party Cookies
content: OK, I just read pages and pages of people frustrated with gaining control over Third Party cookies. We are not seeing the control in our Firefox settings any more. This has become quite important these days since websites like DAA will illustrate the importance of having control over our Third Party cookies. Instead, Firefox has obfuscated the issue behind a shroud of competing procedures and discussion on a blog that is not helping. Meanwhile, we can't even find Third Party Cookies on our standard menu anymore. People NEED to control Third Party Cookies easily and quickly and with the least amount of time spent as possible because we are busy. Thank you in advance for respecting that, Firefox. It is your responsibility, not ours, to make your settings menu serviceable. I do not want to be led into nightmarish web trails looking for something that is normally a part of the software that we use. Firefox needs to put Third Party Cookies back on the main menu of the browser settings and stop wasting our time. Thank you.
creator: distance8

title: Firefox is not even starting! A report to the expert:
content:
Hi everyone. For the last 6 months, the <Firefox.exe> process is being terminated immediately after launching it.

I tried every solution I came across in the internet: from making a fresh clean installation to changing the profile, deleting the cache files and searching for Malwares and viruses. Unfortunately, nothing has worked.

Nevertheless, if I rename the "Firefox.exe" file to any other name, it will work without a problem. And if I kill the <explorer.exe> process, and then run "Frefox.exe" -without changing its name-, it will also function properly.

Before yesterday, I bought a new computer, installed Firefox, and it was working smoothly. However, today, I installed Office 2021 Pro Plus, logged into my Microsoft account from Word and <Firefox.exe> process is being terminated upon lunching it again.

I formatted the system, made a restore point, downloaded another version of office (2019 Pro Plus), logged into my Microsoft account, and the same has happened again. I tried different scenarios; the result is always the same.

  • Same problem is happening with Chrome. Only Edge is working if I logged into my Microsoft account from office apps.

Any idea?
creator: mr.yamanqassem

title: What shortcut key can I press to close the "CTRL + F" search bar at the bottom of the browser?
content: If you press CTRL + F (or F3) it opens up the "CTRL + F" search bar at the bottom of the browser. But in my experience, if I want to close that search bar, I have to manually do it by moving my mouse to the bottom right corner of the browser and clicking the search bar close button. In most applications that I ever used, I could press "CTRL + F" a second time to toggle the search off. Is there a shortcut key that I can use to toggle the search bar off so I don't have to keep manually closing it?

title: Can only see Facebook feed images after clearing Cached Web Content
content:
I am now trapped in a cycle within Firefox where after a few days most or all of the images from my Facebook feed stop displaying. Sometimes the problem will emerge slowly, a few images won't load, then within a day or so none of them will load. Other times, like just now, it will be sudden and no images will display in the feed. All of the other images on the page will display, just no images posted by users/pages in any feed.

The only way to fix this is to go into Firefox preferences and clear the Cashed Web Content. At that point the images will display again, but only for a few days, and then the cycle continues.

What is going on here, and is there anything that can be done to fix it?

I am using Firefox 91.5.1esr (64-bit) on a 2018 Mac Mini running Mojave. My other computers, consisting of both Windows and Mac, all run Firefox and do not have this issue.

Thank you.

title: Suggestions
content: Hello! Please, implement the built-in speed dial, like in Opera and Vivaldi. It's extremely convenient and useful, lots of people need this. I've been using Firefox for more than 10 years and I hate your stupid "Firefox Home" page (sorry) on desktop and Android with icons that add automatically and I can't change and locate. It's inconvenient and completely useless. It would be great if you create something like Opera 12.17 or 12.18 had. In addition, please remove the "close" button in the last tab. I know that I can do it via the "config mode" (browser.tabs.closeWindowWithLastTab), but it's not user-friendly. It's inconvenient when you close the tab just to return home, but the whole browser closes. It makes me nervous. Thank you in advance! You are doing a great job, wish you good luck, and hope that one day Firefox will be more popular than Chromium-based browsers.

title: Can't scale PDF files
content:
Hi, I'm having some issues with printing PDFs from Firefox. A lot of times, I have to scale PDF files more than 100%. I was able to do this before but I am not able to do it now. Whenever I scale a PDF using the scale option in the printing dialog of Firefox, nothing changes. Here's a screenshot:

1. When the "Scale" is set to 100% https://i.imgur.com/BrP3hIA.png 2. When the "Scale" is set to 120% https://i.imgur.com/a1v4t5z.png As you can see, nothing happens when I increase the scale above 100%. I know that the PDF will get cut if I increase it more than 100% but it was still useful when I wanted to only print the top left part of a PDF. Is this a bug or is this intentional? Is there a fix for this?
creator: prayagjain2

title: Firefox doesn't import its own data when reinstalling
content: I was using the browser when suddenly each time I typed in a letter, other letters and numbers were added. I noticed a small print line above the browser box that said , "your organization is managing your browser" with an odd URL. I ran the antivirus and malware scans and there was nothing. I uninstalled Firefox. After leaving the computer off for 12 hours, I returned and the problem is gone but I had uninstalled Firefox. Now on reinstalling, you give me the option to import my data from every browser except Firefox. In order to get my data back I would have to search for, find and follow a large number of suggestions and links from "the community". Where's my old data? If I can get it from Google, why can't I get it from my old Firefox account? I am reluctantly, after many years, going to switch to Google. Since your company doesn't have a lot of contact info, this is the only way I can tell you how disappointed I am. Goodbye Firefox

title: Input control acts as if it is readonly
content:

Could you please tell me how can I investigate this any further?

Thank you, Bogdan

title: Strange issue likely involving Avast-1 of 4 accounts does not run firefox any longer.
content: I recently had installed Avast and after a few days, after running a scan on avast, it found and quarantined a "possible threat" string of code from firefox and my steam app. Unwittingly and to be honest, in a small hurry, I removed the quarantined items and went about my business. I have Windows accounts on my computer, 3 users and an admin. 2 users and the Admin can run FF, but the 1 user account cannot. I have tried some of the troubleshooting steps to create a new profile and have uninstalled the whole mozilla app. I really like the browser and am not having any luck getting FF to work on the one account. I have since uninstalled Avast and have UN and Re installed FF along with trying to create a new profile for my afflicted user account. No luck. When I click the FF app to start it, I get a white flash box, but too quick to read. Also, When I perform a run search for firefox.exe, Windows cannot find it, even though it is on my pc. Please help.
creator: guentzelnd

title: Firefox website taskbar shortcuts
content:
Why does a firefox website Windows 11 taskbar shortcut disappear when unpinning a separate firefox website shortcut?

For example, when I create a desktop shortcut to a website, right click it and select "Show More Options" and then select "Unpin From Taskbar", a previously created website shortcut is removed from the taskbar.

Thank you for taking the time to help me with this issue.
creator: regapal

title: 403 ERROR trying to access https://donate.mozilla.org/help
content:
Hello Using Firefox-ESR, when attempting (multiple times) to access https://donate.mozilla.org/help I receive:

403 ERROR The request could not be satisfied. Request blocked. We can't connect to the server for this app or website at this time. There might be too much traffic or a configuration error. Try again later, or contact the app or website owner. If you provide content to customers through CloudFront, you can find steps to troubleshoot and help prevent this error by reviewing the CloudFront documentation.

Thank you in advance for any assistance you can provide.
creator: rfortier
